Even though the post above me said get the .dat and the .mdl and put them in a folder, i only ended up using the .mdl…

item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Try restarting your client after add model. Also with objects I have had this same problem myself where its all done fine but the object just refuses to appear just try redoing the whole process on a new id (get a new model and do that shit to it) hopefully it helps. Keep trying

item.title: Can't add RSMV files to my client?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:6, topic:285014”][quote author=Oxygenn link=topic=376688.msg2838239#msg2838239 date=1245799622]
Where do I get them? Because I’m just using RSMV’s cache extractor, how do I get the .mdl’s?
[/quote]

odd… my extractor gets the .mdl’s
u can try to do convert new2old, but if it gives you the error message:
too risky mate!
you need the mdl files[/quote]
You know, i laugh at comments like these. Because a 500+ model is diferent from a 499-.
What is the diference you ask?
ANIMATION!!, the animation for a 500+ is directly in the npc itself. For all 499+ the npc is animated to those standards, and is given animations threw the server. An object (as long as you spawn it with makeglobalobject) should appear. So i dont see the problems your having

item.source: Can't add RSMV files to my client?

item.title: Can't add RSMV files to my client?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

its because if your using 500+ models, they are in a different format, although u can convert them to dat just like always, its setup differently and you have to have the original .mdl file
heres what you do:
1st: get your desired model from the cache you want.
2nd: make a copy of the .mdl model and put it somewhere in a folder where you keep your models.
3rd: open the .mdl in datmaker, where it says convert, you choose the new2old option (DO THIS ONLY IF ITS A 500+ MODEL)
4th: after you do this, forget exporting an mqo file, you dont need anything to do with meta unless you editing the model.
5th: since the model already has anim data, no setting of pri is needed, just make the .dat and then do what you did above with the ints, it should work

i hope i helped

EDIT: when i said to only do the new2old option i dont mean do this with a model over the number 500… lol
im referring to the time when runescape went to HD, when they changed alot of their models and the way they are setup

Read full topic
item.source: Can't add RSMV files to my client?

item.title: Can't add RSMV files to my client?
item.dc:creator: @Oxygenn Oxygenn
item.description:
@Oxygenn wrote:

Alright, I’m using RichScape’s client (317 client, 377 cache). And in RSMV I found a model [29920] So I opened it up in dat maker, converted it to mqo, opened it in metaseq. then saved it again(without any edits with metaseq.) and opened it in dat maker, set PRI or whatever to 10 with no animation, made the .dat, gzipped it and renamed it to 14009. Typed add models in-game and i made this in class46.java:

if(i == 9989)//This is the id of the Object (Not the model) { class46.aString739 = "Grand Exchange statue"; class46.aByteArray777 = "Symbolizes the Grand Exchange".getBytes(); class46.anInt744 = 4; class46.anInt761 = 4; class46.anIntArray773 = new int[1]; class46.anIntArray773[0] = 14009; class46.aBoolean778 = true; class46.aBoolean767 = true; class46.aBoolean762 = false; class46.aBoolean769 = false; }
But it didn’t work, i can’t see the object when I spawn it in-game.
Help.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't add RSMV files to my client?
